abstract: With no new bids in the most recent round, the bidding has paused at $4.7 billion for the C Block, the most attractive group of frequencies the government is auctioning off. The name of the winning bidder won’t be known until the rest of the auction finishes, which could take several weeks.
snippet: With no new bids in the most recent round, the bidding has paused at $4.7 billion for the C Block, the most attractive group of frequencies the government is auctioning off. The name of the winning bidder won’t be known until the rest of the aucti...
lead_paragraph: UPDATE: This post was wrong in saying that rules prohibit anyone from bidding higher than $4.7 billion for the C block. There are some rather complex ways that another company could in fact raise the bid in coming days. I’ll write a post explaining this later.

headline.main: Spectrum Auction: The C-Block Bidding Stalls at $4.7 Billion
